name: Is .NET Framework installed?
body:
Try one of the following to find out! A list of installed versions will be displayed.

Paste the following in a PowerShell prompt and press enter twice to run:
```
Get-ChildItem 'HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\NET Framework Setup\NDP' -recurse |
Get-ItemProperty -name Version -EA 0 |
Where { $_.PSChildName -match '^(?!S)\p{L}'} |
Select PSChildName, Version
```

Or download and run this totally safe .NET 2.0 executable which will do essentially the same thing as the PowerShell script above: [DotNetVersionList.exe](http://dl.isdotnetinstalled.com/DotNetVersionList.exe) ([VirusTotal Results](https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/dccd119ca87cd7a68546039f3294a1a5b6b71f0c904c97007c4b56b174b0b319/analysis/1390468602/))
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
